articles.description: In an interview with CBS News' "60 Minutes," House Speaker Nancy Pelosi says there is strong support in the House to impeach President Donald Trump. CNN's Ryan Nobles reports.

articles.title: Stripe will halt processing Trump campaign donations because of encouraged violence
articles.description: Stripe will halt payment processing for President Donald Trump's campaign website after last week's breach of the US Capitol.

articles.author: Elizabeth Cohen, CNN Senior Medical Correspondent
articles.title: Much of US data to catch newest coronavirus variants is several months old
articles.description: As part of the hunt for new coronavirus variants, an international database shows the United States ranks 61st in how quickly virus samples are collected from patients, analyzed and then posted online.

articles.author: Susannah Cullinane, CNN
articles.title: Take a deep breath...freediver swims 662 feet underwater
articles.description: Danish freediver Stig Severinsen has broken the world distance record for swimming with fins on just one breath -- making it 202 meters (662 ft 8.7 in) underwater, Guinness World Records has confirmed.

articles.author: Lauren M. Johnson, CNN
articles.title: Future first dog Major Biden to get virtual 'indoguration'
articles.description: President-elect Joe Biden is not the only one getting some fanfare as he enters the White House -- his rescue dog, Major, is being honored by the shelter he came from.

articles.title: Two men carrying plastic restraints during Capitol riot charged by feds
articles.description: Federal authorities on Sunday arrested two men for their alleged roles in the US Capitol riot, according to a release.

articles.title: Tom Brady leads the Tampa Bay Buccaneers to their first playoff win since 2002
articles.description: The sports world already knows Tom Brady as the greatest quarterback of all time, but he proved it to Tampa Bay this weekend after leading the Buccaneers to their first playoff win since 2002.

articles.title: Republican icon explains why he no longer considers himself a member of the GOP
articles.description: Former Secretary of State Colin Powell weighs in on conservative support for President Donald Trump, explaining to CNN's Fareed Zakaria why he can no longer consider himself a member of the Republican Party.
